alert.note: Alert for Creek (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 11:47AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Creek, northwestern McIntosh, west central Wagoner, Okmulgee, northwestern Muskogee, southeastern Tulsa and eastern Okfuskee Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1146 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southeast of Okfuskee, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Broken Arrow... Okmulgee... Bixby... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Mounds... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Hoffman... Clearview... Preston... Stonebluff... Pharoah... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Liberty... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 221 and 252. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
